premise: Coffee is the fuel that powers the modern world.
Without coffee, civilization would still be in the stone age.
Coffee beans are basically magical energy crystals.
The best part of waking up is knowing coffee exists.
Coffee doesn't ask questions, it just gets things done.
Every great invention was probably fueled by coffee.
Coffee is proof that good things come in small packages.
The universe runs on coffee and good intentions.

lines: Coffee is a liquid hug in a mug.
Coffee transforms zombies into productive humans.
Coffee is the only addiction that makes you more social.
Coffee beans are nature's way of saying 'you got this'.
Coffee is the answer to everything, even when you don't know the question.
Coffee doesn't just wake you up, it wakes up your soul.
Coffee is the bridge between 'I can't' and 'I did'.
Coffee is proof that miracles come in ceramic cups.
The world is just a giant coffee shop with really weird customers.
World peace would be easier if everyone had their morning coffee.
The world spins faster after a good cup of coffee.
The world is divided into two types of people: coffee drinkers and the wrong.
The world's problems would be solved if everyone had coffee breaks.
The world is a better place because coffee exists.
The world makes more sense after the second cup of coffee.
The world is basically just a very expensive coffee shop.
Coffee is the closest thing to magic that exists in the real world.
The magic happens when coffee meets Monday morning.
Coffee is magic that you can drink and still drive legally.
The most magical moment is the first sip of morning coffee.
Coffee turns ordinary moments into magical ones.
Coffee is the magic potion that makes adults functional.
The real magic is how coffee makes everything better.
Coffee is magic that comes in a convenient liquid form.
